snippet: Two recent books, published within a few weeks of each other, explore dalliances in wealthy school districts.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column contends that books Motherland by Amy Sohn and Triburnia by Karl Taro Greenfeld, published within a few weeks of each other, are born more of inevitability than imagination; both books explore dalliances of parents in wealthy New York City school districts and reflect perception that city life has come to resemble suburban life.
lead_paragraph: Two recent books, published within a few weeks of each other, explore dalliances in wealthy school districts.

headline.print_headline: For a Spicier City, Turn the Page?
headline.main: For a Spicier City, Turn the Page?
